sections.heading: What is Nara-conditional?
sections.content:
なら-conditional expresses topic-based conditions - "if [that's the case]" or "if [regarding that topic]". It assumes the condition and gives advice or makes a statement about it.

日本に行くなら、京都がおすすめ "If you're going to Japan, I recommend Kyoto" (assuming you're going) 時間があるなら、手伝ってください "If you have time, please help" (assuming you might have time)

children.heading: With Verbs
children.content: Dictionary form + なら: 行く + なら → 行くなら Plain form + なら: 行かない + なら → 行かないなら

children.heading: With Nouns
children.content: Noun + なら: 学生 + なら → 学生なら "if (you're) a student"

children.heading: With Adjectives
children.content: い-adj + なら: 高い + なら → 高いなら "if it's expensive" な-adj + なら: 静か + なら → 静かなら "if it's quiet"

children.heading: 1. Assumes Information from Context
children.content: A: 明日雨かもしれない "It might rain tomorrow" B: 雨なら、行かない "If it's rain, I won't go" (responding to the topic of rain)

children.heading: 2. Gives Advice/Suggestions
children.content: 日本語を勉強するなら、毎日練習したほうがいい "If you're studying Japanese, you should practice every day" その映画を見るなら、字幕版がいい "If you're watching that movie, the subtitled version is better"

children.heading: 3. Based on Assumption
children.content: 彼が来ないなら、私も行かない "If he's not coming, I'm not going either" お金がないなら、貸してあげる "If you don't have money, I'll lend you some"

sections.heading: When to Use なら
sections.content:
Use なら when:

Responding to given information Making assumptions Giving advice based on condition Topic-based conditions "If that's the case..."

sections.heading: なら vs Other Conditionals
sections.content: | Form | Usage | Focus | | ---- | ------------------ | ------------------- | | なら | Topic condition | Assumption/advice | | たら | Specific condition | After completion | | ば | General condition | Natural consequence | | と | Automatic result | Inevitable outcome |

children.heading: Comparison Examples
children.content: なら: 日本に行くなら、桜の季節がいい "If you're going to Japan, cherry blossom season is good" (advice based on assumption you're going) たら: 日本に行ったら、京都に行こう "When we go to Japan, let's go to Kyoto" (specific plan after arrival) ば: 日本に行けば、桜が見られる "If you go to Japan, you can see cherry blossoms" (general condition-result) と: 日本に行くと、日本語が必要だ "When you go to Japan, Japanese is necessary" (inevitable fact)

children.heading: Giving Advice
children.content: 風邪なら、休んだほうがいい "If you have a cold, you should rest" 分からないなら、聞いたほうがいい "If you don't understand, you should ask" お腹が空いているなら、食べてもいいよ "If you're hungry, you can eat"

children.heading: Making Offers
children.content: 困っているなら、手伝おうか？ "If you're in trouble, shall I help?" 忙しいなら、明日にしましょう "If you're busy, let's do it tomorrow" 疲れたなら、休憩しよう "If you're tired, let's take a break"

children.heading: Responding to Information
children.content: A: 明日暇？ "Are you free tomorrow?" B: 暇なら、何？ "If I'm free, what?" A: 映画でも見に行かない？ "Want to go see a movie or something?"

children.heading: With Verbs
children.content: 行くなら、早く行ったほうがいい "If you're going, you should go early" 買うなら、このお店がいい "If you're buying, this store is good" やるなら、今すぐやれ "If you're going to do it, do it now"

children.heading: With Nouns
children.content: 学生なら、割引があります "If you're a student, there's a discount" 日本人なら、分かるはず "If you're Japanese, you should understand" 初心者なら、これがおすすめ "If you're a beginner, I recommend this"

children.heading: With Adjectives
children.content: 安いなら、買いたい "If it's cheap, I want to buy it" 美味しいなら、食べてみたい "If it's delicious, I want to try it" 簡単なら、やってみる "If it's easy, I'll try it"

sections.heading: Negative なら
sections.content: 行かないなら、教えて "If you're not going, let me know" 食べないなら、私が食べる "If you're not eating it, I'll eat it" 知らないなら、聞いてみよう "If you don't know, let's ask"

children.heading: それなら / だったら
children.content: A: 疲れた "I'm tired" B: それなら / だったら、休もう "If that's the case, let's rest"

children.heading: もし～なら
children.content: もし時間があるなら、来てください "If you happen to have time, please come" もし雨なら、中止です "If it's rain, it's cancelled"

children.heading: ～なら～ほど
children.content: 安いなら安いほどいい "The cheaper, the better" 早いなら早いほどいい "The earlier, the better"

children.heading: Example 1: Making Plans
children.content: A: 明日どこか行く？ "Are you going somewhere tomorrow?" B: まだ決めてない "I haven't decided yet" A: 行くなら、一緒に行こう "If you're going, let's go together" B: いいね！ "Sounds good!"

children.heading: Example 2: Giving Advice
children.content: A: 日本語が上手になりたい "I want to get better at Japanese" B: 上手になりたいなら、毎日勉強したほうがいい "If you want to get better, you should study every day" A: 何を勉強すればいい？ "What should I study?" B: 初心者なら、ひらがなから始めるといい "If you're a beginner, it's good to start with hiragana"

children.heading: Example 3: Responding
children.content: A: このレストラン、高いかな？ "I wonder if this restaurant is expensive?" B: 高くないよ "It's not expensive" A: じゃあ、行こう "Then, let's go" B: 行くなら、予約したほうがいいよ "If we're going, we should make a reservation"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using なら for Automatic Results
children.content: Wrong: 押すなら、開く ❌ Right: 押すと、開く ✓ "When you push, it opens" なら is for topic-based, not automatic results!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using なら for Completed Actions
children.content: Wrong: 家に帰るなら、誰もいなかった ❌ Right: 家に帰ったら、誰もいなかった ✓ "When I got home, no one was there"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing with たら
children.content: Less natural: 明日晴れるなら、行こう Natural: 明日晴れたら、行こう ✓ "If it's sunny tomorrow, let's go" (たら better for future specific conditions)

children.heading: Giving Recommendations
children.content: 京都に行くなら、春がいい "If you're going to Kyoto, spring is good" この本を読むなら、静かな場所がいい "If you're reading this book, a quiet place is good"

children.heading: Responding to Context
children.content: A: お腹空いた "I'm hungry" B: お腹空いたなら、何か食べよう "If you're hungry, let's eat something"

children.heading: Topic-Based Conditions
children.content: 学生なら、半額です "If you're a student, it's half price" 会員なら、無料です "If you're a member, it's free"

sections.heading: Nuance Differences
sections.content: 日本に行くなら (topic-based) "If you're going to Japan..." (advice follows) 日本に行けば (general) "If you go to Japan..." (result follows) 日本に行ったら (specific) "When you go to Japan..." (after arrival) 日本に行くと (automatic) "When you go to Japan..." (inevitable result)

sections.heading: Practice Sentences
sections.content: 時間があるなら、手伝ってください "If you have time, please help" 彼が来ないなら、中止にしよう "If he's not coming, let's cancel" 安いなら、買いたい "If it's cheap, I want to buy it" 日本語を勉強するなら、この本がいい "If you're studying Japanese, this book is good" 分からないなら、聞いてください "If you don't understand, please ask" 学生なら、割引があります "If you're a student, there's a discount" 行くなら、私も行く "If you're going, I'll go too" それなら、大丈夫です "If that's the case, it's okay"

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ なら = topic-based condition ✓ Assumes information from context ✓ Perfect for giving advice ✓ "If that's the case..." ✓ Works with verbs, nouns, adjectives ✓ Responds to given information ✓ Different from たら/ば/と ✓ Cannot use for automatic results ✓ Best for assumptions and suggestions

Master nara-conditional - respond naturally to context!
